paper_keywords: Volterra integral equation of convolution type
numerical simulation of linear and nonlinear time invariant systems
paper_abstract: Variable stepsize algorithms for the numerical solution of nonlinear Volterra integral and integro-differential equations of convolution type are described. These algorithms are based on an embedded pair of Runge-Kutta methods of order p = 5 and p = 4 proposed by Dormand and Prince with interpolation of uniform order p = 4. They require O(N) number of kernel evaluations, where N is the number of steps. The cost of the algorithms can be further reduced for equations that have rapidly vanishing convolution kernels, by using waveform relaxation iterations after computing the numerical approximation by variable stepsize algorithm on some initial interval.
paper_title: Numerical solution of Volterra integral and integro-differential equations with rapidly vanishing convolution kernels
